cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north tonight then accelerate north-northeast across the U.S. Gulf Coast on Wednesday, cross the Southeast, and move off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the open Atlantic Thursday night–Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Morgan City–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL; Storm-Surge Warning Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–AL), then inland across MS, AL, GA, TN, the southern Appalachians, Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds possible late Thu night–Fri (25–35 mph) as the post-tropical remnants pass south and east of Boston
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (less than 1 ft) or elevated tides possible; significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday with localized downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and rip currents along Massachusetts Bay; brief marine visibility restrictions in heavy rain
